__e: No, but, Dad, no one cared that I was gone.
I never cared whether you were a girl or a boy.
He didn't even care that I was a local celebrity, which made me want him all the more.
And the burden of proof had nothing to do with it.
He... He... He just gave himself permission to do whatever the fuck he wanted in the name of his work and he didn't care who he made suffer.
I couldn't afford anything, but it never mattered to this guy.
But you didn't give a damn about that as long as you could grab the spotlight.
I have been on my own since I was 15 years old, scrambling for cash, and nobody gives a fuck.
Or maybe he wasn't home enough to have any conversation about anything or, or maybe by the time he got ready to talk, I didn't give a shit.
Which didn't matter, because he'd already murdered his neighbors by then.
And yes, a lot of things did go wrong, but it didn't matter because when I look back on that day, what I remember is the first wedding;
But it didn't matter because I accounted for everyone.
You know, the only reason you can move on Is because you never even cared in the first place.
My dad never seemed to care about anything else I did.
I find it weird that you never cared about anything I did until I tried something you like.
